intro: Echium espagnolis, commonly known as Spanish thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple or blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has spiny leaves and produces a distinctive, spiky seed head that persists through the winter. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Echium espagnolis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
